business.headline: Gold crosses Rs 1.61 lakh, silver nears Rs 2.7 lakh in fresh rally: Should you buy?Precious metals are back in focus as gold climbs above Rs 1.61 lakh and silver approaches Rs 2.7 lakh. The steady rise has sparked fresh interest among investors, raising the key question, i.e., is this the right time to buy?

Global economy heading towards 2008-like crisis due to AI? Jamie Dimon answersJamie Dimon, JPMorgan CEO, said that some lenders and financial players are doing "dumb things" to make money in the current market environment, which he described as risky and uncertain.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS rise up to 4%: Why are IT stocks rising today?IT stocks may still be under pressure, but today's rebound shows confidence returning. The clash between AI anxiety and long-term opportunity is reshaping the narrative, pulling investors back into one of India's most-watched sectors.

Waaree Energies shares fall 15%: What triggered the sharp fall today?Waaree Energy share price: Over the past six months, the stock has declined by Rs 464.50, or 14.74%. However, on a one-year basis, it is still up by Rs 417.85, or 18.42%, according to the latest data.

Sensex gains 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex rose 564.63 points to 82,790.45. The NSE Nifty50 gained 167.00 points to 25,591.65 as of 9:28 am. Both indices were up by over 0.5% in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty rally in early trade led by IT stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 515.54 points to 82,741.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 181.95 points to 25,606.60 as of 11:19 am.

Sensex, Nifty trading setup: Will stock market fall again today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,671.5 at 8:00 am. This suggests that the benchmark Nifty 50 may open above Tuesday's closing level of 25,424.65.

India-Israel free trade talks kick off in Delhi ahead of PM Modi's visit to IsraelAhead of PM Modi's visit to Israel on Wednesday, India and Israel began the first round of negotiations for a proposed Free Trade Agreement in New Delhi.

Venezuela sends mega 2-million-barrel oil cargoes to India as exports surgeVenezuela has chartered its first supertankers since easing US sanctions, boosting crude exports to India as refiners seek discounted heavy oil and diversify away from Russian supplies.

Tata Sons defers N Chandrasekaran's 3rd term decision after Noel Tata's conditionsN Chandrasekaran's term ends in February 2027, and the board of Tata Sons was discussing extending the same when a set of conditions was put forth by Noel Tata.

Kalyani Group firms settle Sebi case for Rs 4.12 crore after NSE reportKalyani Group's two listed companies have settled Sebi proceedings over alleged fund diversion, paying over Rs 4.12 crore without admitting guilt. The regulator's probe revealed suspicious investments and multi-layered transactions involving related parties.

Want to save tax legally? Here are 5 ways to earn income tax-freeYou don't always need complicated tricks to save on taxes. Certain incomes and investments in India are fully exempt, letting you save while staying within the law.

Silver falls over Rs 5000, gold drops Rs 1,000: Is this a buying opportunity?Bullion prices came under pressure, with silver and gold both slipping on Tuesday. After the recent correction, investors are now watching closely to see if lower prices present a buying opportunity.

IDFC First Bank transfers Rs 583 crore to Haryana following fraud incidentAccording to a stock market filing, IDFC bank has paid out 100% of the principal and interest to the relevant departments of Haryana Government as claimed, which works out to a net amount of INR 583 crore.

Taken a home loan? Here's what happens if you miss 3 EMIsA home loan EMI is a long-term responsibility that borrowers usually plan for carefully. But income disruptions or unexpected expenses can affect repayments. If EMIs are missed repeatedly, how do lenders react, and how serious can it become? Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 1,068 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 1,068.74 points to close at 82,225.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 288.35 points to end at 25,424.65.

Why are India's ultra-rich preferring Gurugram over Mumbai for their homesMumbai recorded ultra-luxury home sales worth Rs 24,120 crore during the calendar year. This is the highest ever value achieved by any Indian city in this segment.

Paying rent to parents or spouse to save tax? New rules tighten HRA claimsClaiming HRA by paying rent to family members has been a common tax-saving method. Yet, changes expected from April 2026 could make these claims more closely examined than before.

Is redevelopment a safe bet for real estate investors?Redevelopment today is not just about replacing old buildings. It is about creating larger, more valuable assets that align with how people live and work now, closer to transport, offices, and social infrastructure.

IDFC First Bank's Rs 590-crore fraud: What went wrong and how bad is the damage?A fraud this size should never have slipped past routine controls. This article attempts to explain just how sharply the Rs 590-crore fraud impacts IDFC First Bank.

entertainment.headline: What propaganda film? Shatrughan Sinha calls Dhurandhar a masterpiece Shatrughan Sinha praised Dhurandhar, calling it an absolute masterpiece. Apart from the cast, he also expressed admiration for the technical brilliance of the film.

Karan Kundrra's portrait tattoo of Tejasswi Prakash sparks social media buzz Television actor Karan Kundrra was spotted flaunting a portrait tattoo of girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash at a Ramzan event in Mumbai. The tattoo sparked widespread fan excitement and debate over its authenticity.

Rashmika-Vijay wedding: Directors Sandeep Vanga, Rahul Ravindran in Udaipur. Video Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna are set to marry on February 26 in Udaipur, with their wedding celebrations already underway and receiving special wishes from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Heavy metal diva: Yerin Ha is rockstar of style at Bridgerton 4 London premiere Yerin Ha dazzled in a metallic dress at a special Bridgerton screening in London as anticipation builds for the next episodes.

Pedro Pascal outing with director Rafael Olarra sparks online buzz. Viral video Photographs of Pedro Pascal and Rafael Olarra together in New York and Los Angeles have sparked renewed interest in their respective dating lives. In the photos, the duo could be seen walking hand-in-hand.

PM Modi sends wedding wishes for Rashmika and Vijay: Divinely scripted chapter Prime Minister Narendra Modi has extended a heartfelt note of congratulations to actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna on the occasion of their wedding, scheduled to take place on February 26, 2026, in Udaipur.

Ramayana: Part I first cut screened in Los Angeles 9 months before release A test screening of Ramayana: Part I in Los Angeles has drawn positive early reactions. The Nitesh Tiwari directorial was screened only as the film's first cut, not the final version.

Shoaib Ibrahim shares update after wife Dipika Kakar's cyst surgery Actor Dipika Kakar recently underwent a cyst removal surgery following her battle with stage 2 liver cancer. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, updated fans that the procedure was successful and she is now recovering.

Actor Sophie Turner dazzles in a sparkling mini as she celebrates 30 Sophie Turner marked her 30th birthday with an extravagant party and unveiled her portrayal of Lara Croft for the new Tomb Raider series, generating strong responses from fans across social media.

Dunki was a gift after 10 years of struggle, says Taapsee Pannu Taapsee Pannu shares her perspective on working in both commercial and serious films, reflecting on her journey in the industry and her role in Rajkumar Hirani's Dunki.

Katrina Kaif waves at paps from car in first appearance since son's birth. Video Katrina Kaif was seen in Mumbai for the first time after welcoming her son, Vihaan Kaushal. The actor was spotted with her fitness trainer and greeted fans from her car.

Hamnet review: Paul Mescal, Jessie Buckley anchor this haunting literary adaptationRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Hamnet movie review: Hamnet is an emotionally shattering adaptation of Maggie O'Farrell's novel by Chloé Zhao. The film explores love, loss, and creativity.

From Jason Sanjay to Akira Nandan: South star kids go behind the lens Instead of chasing instant stardom by facing the camera, a new generation of star children in the South is choosing diverse occupations such as direction and music, in a bid to step into the spotlight with a difference.

Rashmika-Vijay treat paps with lavish lunch, dinner at Udaipur wedding | Exclusive Actors Vijay Deverkonda and Rashmika Mandanna are getting married in Udaipur on February 26. They have graciously hosted the paparazzi and media with meals despite keeping the event private.

Rashmika-Vijay's sangeet decor is a love story told through pictures. Viral video Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's sangeet decor showcases their love story through intimate pictures. The wedding is set to take place on February 26.

The Kerala Story 2 makers grilled over absence of Malayali victim at press event A press conference in Delhi for The Kerala Story 2 became heated as journalists questioned the filmmakers about the film's portrayal of Kerala, and why no "Malayali victim" was a part of their event.

Arijit Singh opens up about unreleased songs in first message since playback exit Arijit Singh shared a heartfelt message with his listeners following his decision to step back from accepting new playback assignments, clarifying that several unreleased songs will continue to emerge throughout the year.

Is Tom Cruise banking too much on nostalgia to remain the world's biggest star? Tom Cruise's next film is an original dark-comedy, The Digger. However, reports suggest the Hollywood superstar heavily relies on nostalgia thereafter, with talk of Mission: Impossible reboot, Days of Thunder 2 and Top Gun 3. Does the world's biggest star plan to bank on yesteryear's glory?

Rashmika-Vijay to wed in two ceremonies honouring Kodava and Telugu roots: Report Reports suggest that Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna will honour both Telugu and Kodava traditions with two distinct wedding ceremonies in Udaipur. The two will get married on February 26.

general news.headline: We're perturbed: Supreme Court on 'corruption in judiciary' mention in NCERT chapterTaking note of an NCERT textbook chapter on 'corruption in the judiciary', Chief Justice of India Surya Kant said that he will be taking action in the matter and that the court would not permit any attack on the judicial institution.

Trump's new India-Pak truce claim, says Sharif told him 35 million would've diedIn a bombshell revelation, US President Donald Trump claimed that Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif told him that 35 million people would have died in India's Operation Sindoor had he not intervened.

Bizarre, unacceptable: Govt on BSNL director over Prayagraj visit VIP protocol rowThe Centre has issued a showcause notice to a BSNL director after an elaborate protocol plan for his proposed Prayagraj visit, involving deployment of 50 staff for personal and religious tours, sparked widespread outrage.
How Pakistani, Khalistani threats forced Indian restaurant in UK to shut shopHow Pakistani, Khalistani threats forced Indian restaurant in UK to shut shop

BSNL Chauka! VIP (underwear) Culture in 21 PointsThe world is going from 5G to 6G while BSNL, a PSU in ICU for years, is going strong on G-Huzoori. Fifty staffers waiting on hand and foot for a BSNL director's Prayagraj trip shows how bureaucrats take power as a privilege.

Delhi teen named in Goa Thar crash case, claims of seat swap to save woman driverA speeding Mahindra Thar allegedly driven by a teenager crashed into a car in Goa, killing a 65-year-old man. Locals claimed that after the accident, he switched seats to shield a woman.

Threat to Muslim Ummah: Israel's Hexagon plan with India spooks PakFollowing Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's proposal to launch an anti-radical Hexagon alliance, including India, the Pakistani Parliament's Senate has rushed to unanimously pass a resolution. The resolution tabled by a PPP leader, which is part of PM Shehbaz Sharif's ruling coalition, described the alliance as a threat to the integrity and unity of the Muslim Ummah.

Started 5 years ago, Anthropic now worth more than Infosys, TCS, Wipro, HCLAnthropic is an AI giant and a boogeyman as far as Indian IT industry is concerned. Yet, the surprising fact is that this is a 5-year-old company. In these five years it has gone from being a safety-focused AI startup to a $380 billion behemoth, now worth more than Indian tech giants TCS, Infosys, Wipro and HCLTech combined.

Delhi loves momo, but why is it hard for many to accept the people behind them?The racial attack on three Arunachal Pradesh women in Delhi's Malviya Nagar has reopened a long-pending question: why is their food embraced, but not the people?

Live: Last 10 minutes, section-wise analysis shortlyThe CBSE Class 10 Science Board Exam 2026 commenced at 10:30 am and will conclude at 1:30 pm, following the official examination schedule. According to official data, more than 25 lakh students have registered for the Class 10 board exams this year. The Science theory examination will carry 80 marks and feature 39 compulsory questions. Students are advised to follow CBSE exam guidelines, reach their centres on time, and carefully read the question paper instructions before attempting the answers.

Trump calls for Delilah law. How it may affect Indian truck drivers?Trump has urged the US Congress to pass the so-called Delilah Law in his SOTU address. The President named it after a seven-year-old who was grievously injured after being hit by a truck being driven by an illegal Indian immigrant. Here's how the proposed law may impact Indian truck drivers in the US.

We are ashamed, but people need to know our truth: Delhi couple amid racism rowThe accused, Harsh Singh, said that he and his wife did not intend to use any racial slur against the women belonging to Arunachal Pradesh.

India's 10-minute house help craze is growing, but the math is not math-ingUrban India has a new craze. No surprises here, this one too caters to its never-ending appetite for convenience. This time, it involves using apps to call a house help to your doorstep within 10 minutes. At the moment, workers enrolling on these apps are benefiting significantly. Customers are too, thanks to heavily discounted pricing. But for how long?

Odisha mining officer caught with Rs 4 crore in cash in state's record seizureThe Odisha Vigilance Department conducted its biggest cash seizure to date, arresting a senior mining officer after recovering over Rs 4 crore in unaccounted cash during multiple raids.

Kerala to become Keralam. But why West Bengal failed to become Bongo or Bangla?The Union Cabinet cleared the proposal to rename Kerala as Keralam. This paves the way for Parliament to take up the constitutional amendment. But West Bengal, which has pushed for a name change multiple times from the days of Jyoti Basu to Mamata Banerjee, has failed to secure the Centre's nod. So, why couldn't West Bengal get its name changed even after proposing it at least four times?

Turning the tide in Chennai: Inside India's 4-hour grind against absence of paceT20 World Cup: With Rinku Singh absent and Zimbabwe looming, India spent four hours on Tuesday evening in Chennai against spin and pace-off. The focus was on Abhishek Sharma's poise against spin and Sanju Samson's struggle for rhythm as they prepared to face Zimbabwe on Thursday.

Millennials are fired. Gen Z isn't interested. Who will lead corporate India?Corporate India faces a leadership crisis as millennials struggle with job insecurity and Gen Z redefines ambition. The future demands a new model blending AI fluency with collaborative and purpose-driven leadership.

Five days on, investigators say the alleged cover-up may prove as crucial as the murder itself.

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda and the love story fans noticed long beforeKnown to fans as ViRosh, Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's love story is believed to have grown quietly over years of friendship and shared moments, away from the spotlight. From co-stars to life partners, their easy and unhurried bond is what has made audiences across India root for them.

Trump's 'Somali pirates' swipe at Ilhan Omar; Democrat fires back, calls him 'liar'Trump renewed his attack on Democratic Representative Ilhan Omar, saying 'Somali pirates ransacked Minnesota'. She called him a 'liar' from the audience.

No black box on Jharkhand air ambulance that crashed makes probe complicatedJharkhand air ambulance crash: The aircraft had departed Ranchi around 7:11 pm for Delhi and lost communication and radar contact roughly 23 minutes after take-off, after requesting a weather deviation. The wreckage was later found in a forested area near Simaria in Chatra district.

sports.headline: Babar Azam 'undroppable' due to politics; Hesson using him as 'insurance': Vaughan Former England captain Michael Vaughan said Babar Azam remains undroppable in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2026 campaign due to internal dynamics, but praised coach Mike Hesson for using him smartly as an "insurance policy."

Ranji Trophy final: Tempers flare as J&K skipper headbutts Karnataka's KV Aneesh Ranji trophy final: Tempers flared during the Ranji Trophy final as Jammu and Kashmir skipper Paras Dogra was involved in a heated altercation with Karnataka's KV Aneesh. Dogra headbutted Aneesh with players and officials stepping in to defuse the situation.

Sanjay Manjrekar mocks Gautam Gambhir's tactics after South Africa thrashing Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar criticised head coach Gautam Gambhir for what he described as puzzling tactical decisions during the Super 8 clash against South Africa, where the defending champions crashed to a 76-run defeat.

Gambhir, no more experiments please: Can India coach solve the T20 World Cup woes? T20 World Cup: As India find themselves in a tricky spot in the T20 World Cup 2026, the spotlight and pressure once again fall on Gautam Gambhir. With the experience on his side, can the India coach turn the tide and salvage India's faltering campaign?

Court orders Dhawan's ex-wife to return Rs 5.7 cr, cites extortion and trickery Former India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan won a major legal battle as a Delhi family court ordered his ex-wife to return Rs 5.7 crore, declaring the property settlement null and void due to extortion and fraud.

Hope New Zealand lose: Shaheen admits Pakistan's semifinal hopes out of their hands Here's the full transcript of Shaheen Afridi's press conference after the Super 8 clash between Pakistan and England in Pallekele.

Trust Hardik Pandya: Kumble says promote India all-rounder in case of another collapse T20 World Cup: Anil Kumble said that India should trust Hardik Pandya and promote him up the order if they suffer another batting collapse during the T20 World Cup 2026. Hardik has a brilliant record coming in at No.4 and No.5 in T20Is for India.

PAK vs ENG, Super 8s: Shaheen Afridi in awe of Harry Brook's heroics in Pallekele PAK vs ENG, T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi praised Harry Brook's match-winning century as "the best innings of his life" after England secured a thrilling semifinal berth in Pallekele.

Axar or Sundar? Why not both says Shastri ahead of India's do-or-die Super 8s clash IND vs ZIM, T20 World Cup Super 8s: Former India coach Ravi Shastri advocates playing both Axar Patel and Washington Sundar against Zimbabwe, saying the team needs an extra bowling option after their loss to South Africa.

The focus was on Abhishek Sharma's poise against spin and Sanju Samson's struggle for rhythm as they prepared to face Zimbabwe on Thursday.

After Pakistan hundred, will Brook continue at No.3? England captain reactsT20 World Cup: Harry Brook remains coy on the chances of him continuing at the No.3 spot after his incredible knock against Pakistan. Brook's maiden T20I hundred helped England secure a fine win to make it to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup 2026.

NZ vs SL, Super 8 preview: Sri Lanka look for redemption after England horrorT20 World Cup, NZ vs SL: Mitchell Santner's New Zealand and Dasun Shanaka's Sri Lanka are set to lock horns in a crucial Super 8 clash on Wednesday, with only one semifinal spot remaining from Group 2.

Amid PAK snub buzz, ECB tells Hundred teams to pick players on meritThe England and Wales Cricket Board, along with all eight franchises of The Hundred, have declared that player selection will remain rooted in performance and availability, following concerns about the potential exclusion of Pakistan players during the upcoming auction.

India's perennial spin conundrum: Can't play spin, now can't bowl spin?India are facing a severe conundrum in the T20 World Cup. Neither have they been able to bat well against spin, nor are they bowling it well in the tournament.

How Brendon McCullum's masterplan downed Pakistan in Pallekele? Harry Brook revealsHarry Brook's century helped England chase down Pakistan's 165 in the T20 World Cup Super 8 fixture and qualify for the semi-final. Following their win, Brook revealed head coach Brendon McCullum's tactical masterstroke that helped them edge past Pakistan.

T20 World Cup: Can Pakistan still qualify for semi-final?Pakistan were beaten by England in the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup 2026. After their loss, Pakistan are on the brink of an exit from the tournament. But, can the Cornered Tigers still qualify?

Harry Brook's historic century sinks Pakistan, fires England into T20 World Cup semisT20 World Cup, ENG vs PAK: Harry Brook smashed 100 off 51 balls as England defeated Pakistan by two wickets in Pallekele to seal their place in the semifinals. With this loss, Pakistan now find themselves in a must-win situation heading into their final Super 8 clash against Sri Lanka.

After historic T20 WC, Italy Cricket hit with sexual assault allegations: ReportItaly Cricket has suspended an unnamed official from their federation after allegations over inappropriately touching a member of Italy's women's national team.

Rinku Singh leaves India camp, returns home due to family emergencyIndia batter Rinku Singh has left the national camp and returned home following a family emergency. India Today TV has learnt that his father, Khanchand Singh, is in a serious condition and has been admitted to a local hospital in Greater Noida.

Afghanistan name ex-Pakistan coach as head coach after Jonathan Trott departsRichard Pybus has replaced Jonathan Trott as head coach and will join the team ahead of the ODI and T20I series against Sri Lanka in March. Trott stepped down after Afghanistan's campaign in the Men's T20 World Cup.

Lucknow Super Giants reveal new elephant-inspired logo ahead of IPL 2026Lucknow Super Giants unveiled their new logo ahead of this year's Indian Premier League season, saying it "carries the spirit of the city, Uttar Pradesh and the fans who have stood by the franchise since the start."

Mitchell Santner wary of Sri Lanka challenge as race for semi-finals intensifiesT20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs SL: Speaking to the reporters, New Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that the Kiwis are wary of the threat that Sri Lanka may pose in their Super 8 clash on Wednesday in Colombo.

T20 World Cup semi-final, final tickets on sale. But where is the match?The T20 World Cup semi-final and finals tickets have gone live on sale. Tickets are available for Kolkata, Mumbai, Ahmedabad and Colombo, without even knowing at which exact venue the matches will be played?

Influencer receives rape threats, deletes viral T20 World Cup reel with David MillerInfluencer Princy Parikh deleted her viral reel with David Miller after receiving rape threats and body-shaming abuse online during the ongoing T20 World Cup.

ENG vs PAK, Super 8 Highlights: Harry Brook's century guides England into semi finalEngland (ENG) vs Pakistan (PAK), T20 World Cup Super 8 Highlights: England qualified for the semi-final, following a 2-wicket victory in Pallekele. Captain Harry Brook led from the front with his 51-ball hundred while Shaheen Afridi's remarkable spell of 4/30 went in vain.

Pandya, Dube not Malcolm Marshall, India missing Kuldeep: Shoaib AkhtarFormer Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has criticised India's bowling strategy after their heavy defeat to South Africa in the T20 World Cup. He highlighted the need to include Kuldeep Yadav to strengthen India's bowling attack in upcoming matches.

New Zealand will keep a close eye on Pakistan vs England clash: Mitchell SantnerT20 World Cup, NZ vs SL: Skipper Mitchell Santner said New Zealand will keep a close eye on the Pakistan‑England clash on Tuesday in Pallekele as the race for semifinal spots intensifies.

From 300 alert to do or die: Star Sports eats a humble pie in T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Star Sports has been forced to eat humble pie at the ICC T20 World Cup 2026. After a bullish advertising campaign, the broadcaster has had to dial down its tone following India's loss to South Africa in Ahmedabad.

India Women falter in world champion era, suffer 6-wicket defeat to AustraliaINDW vs AUSW, 1st ODI: Harmanpreet Kaur's India slumped to a six-wicket defeat to Alyssa Healy's Australia on Tuesday at the Allan Border Field in Brisbane. Beth Mooney, who completed 3000 ODI runs, won the Player of the Match award.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
